### Step 0: Load the Data
Let's read the file which contains the seatbelt data
```{r }
setwd("~/Projects/Detroit Project/detroit-crime-education/data/clean/crime")
crimes.detroit = read.csv("Detroit-Crimes.csv")
colnames(crimes.detroit)
```

### Step 1: Data Cleaning
What kind of data are in the Detroit Crime data? 
```{r}
#Find class of crime data (dataframe)
class(crimes.detroit)

#Find the dimensions(rows , columns) of seatbelts
dim(crimes.detroit)
#Names of columns in dataframe
colnames(crimes.detroit)
#Summary data in dataframe
summary(crimes.detroit)
```

How many cases are in the observed data?
```{r}
nrow(crimes.detroit) #15 rows, 1 for each year
head(crimes.detroit)
#So many factors!!



```

```{r}
#Factor
colnames(crimes.detroit)
crimes.detroit$robberies<- as.numeric(gsub(",","", as.character(crimes.detroit$robberies)))
crimes.detroit$arson<- as.numeric(gsub(",","", (as.character(crimes.detroit$arson)))

crimes.detroit$assaults<- as.numeric(gsub(",","", (as.character(crimes.detroit$assaults)))
crimes.detroit$assaults.100K<- as.numeric(gsub(",","", (as.character(crimes.detroit$assaults.100K)))

crimes.detroit$burglaries<- as.numeric(gsub(",","", (as.character(crimes.detroit$burglaries)))
crimes.detroit$burglaries.100K<- as.numeric(gsub(",","", (as.character(crimes.detroit$burglaries.100K)))

crimes.detroit$thefts<- as.numeric(gsub(",","", (as.character(crimes.detroit$thefts)))
crimes.detroit$thefts.100K<- as.numeric(gsub(",","", (as.character(crimes.detroit$thefts.100K)))

crimes.detroit$auto.thefts<- as.numeric(gsub(",","", (as.character(crimes.detroit$auto.thefts)))
crimes.detroit$auto.thefts.100K<- as.numeric(gsub(",","", (as.character(crimes.detroit$auto.thefts.100K)))


head(crimes.detroit)
summary(crimes.detroit)
```

what variables are observed for each month?


```{r}
crimes.detroit.100K

      fill=I("orange"))
```

Putting it all together!
```{r}
ggplot(data=crimes.detroit.100K, aes(x=factor(year), y=robberies.100K)) + 
    geom_line() +
    geom_point()

```




```{r}
library(ggplot2)
library(reshape2)
d <- melt(crimes.detroit.100K, id.vars="year")

# Everything on the same plot

ggplot(d, aes(year,value, col=variable)) + 
  geom_point() + 
  stat_smooth() 

# Separate plots
ggplot(d, aes(year,value)) + 
  geom_point() + 
  stat_smooth() +
  facet_wrap(~variable)
```
